review:
Background: I had a Leeco 55 inch 4K television which stopped working due to display fault within 6 months of purchase. Since Leeco went out of India, i was not able to get the warranty. Heartbroken, i waited for 1 year before i bought this TV. i was inclined to get Samsung/LG this time but price of 55 inch 4K TV from those companies was still out of reach. I planned to get VU, but then the problem started, In my budget i saw this TV as well as similar model (LTDN55XT780XWAU3D) which has almost same features. That model is older version and will be phased out soon. VU website showcases this TV and not the other model. So i decided to purchase this. Also the deciding factor was that this TV runs Android and not the old Opera OS of the previous model.

Setup and Installation: It was quick and was done much earlier than stated. No issues in that

Hardware: The TV panel Looks good, but its much thicker than my 2 year old (dead) Leeco TV which was much more sleek looking. The stands are okay and the wall mount came free, although i used my existing wall mount.
The remote is cheap, and i mean really cheap. The older model had better remote than this.

Software: Although this being an android TV, the OS has not been well thought out and faced multiple issues while navigating the interface. Just to give you an example, you cannot switch source (HDMI1 HDMI2 etc) while watching any video or using any apps (such as netflix). Why on earth its not possible is beyond me! you should be able to switch source from anywhere to anywhere. To switch source you have to come back to the home screen...navigate to the switch source picture and then click it (although there is a big button for switching source in the remote itself). Second example, you cannot change picture or audio settings while you are on the android interface. I am yet to comprehend why its so. To change the picture settings (contrast brightness etc.) you need to switch to HDMI 1 or HDMI 2 and do it and then return to android interface. till now i have not found how to do it. the "menu button" does not do anything in these scenarios (which is used to invoke settings dialogue in HDMI sources)
Third, i have seen multiple hangs in my 1 week of usage in Netflix and Youtube and there are times the remote will not do anything however hard i might try. Fourth, compared to my old 55 inch 4k TV, the voutube videos and the netflix videos are not that crist, even 1080 feels like 720p. Since i can compare i notice these, regular users will not notice this issue.

Saying that, my family uses this interface and for them its okay and they hardly notices these since all they watch is youtube and netflix from the smart apps. They do not complain.

My Setup: I have my PC hooked up with this TV via HDMI and my Sony HOme Theater via HDMI (ARC) as well.

Picture Quality: When i use it to display my PC content the picture quality is good. I have no complains. The Black levels are pretty okay for a cheap 55inch TV and there is no major Light bleeding from the edge. But please remember this is not an OLED panel, so do not expect pure Black. In this regard it is better than my old Leeco 55 inch TV.
4K content looks superb and you can adjust multiple parameters to suit your needs. Also note that this comes with HDR 10 and it works in Games (Far cry 5, Mass Effect Andromeda etc). I keep the TV at brightness and Backlight set at 50 and contrast at 80 and sharpness at 100.
Overall, picture quality wise (in PC - HDMI mode) is very satisfactory and it serves my purpose right. Those who solely needs the smart features and fully dependant on it, i would suggest go for the Official android version TV from this company (although priced higher). For light to moderate usage of smart features and actual picture quality wise this TV is Satisfactory.

Ordered 55 4k on 12th July for watching world cup final. Got the demo and installation done on 14th July. So thumbs up to Flipkart for quick service!

TV is easy to use and quite intuitive, though demo by Jeeves could have been a little more detailed to understand more TV features.

Netflix and Youtube work seamlessly on this. Liked the e-share app which lets you 'talk' to your TV - you can display pictures, cast your phone, transfer data etc. through the app. Overall a great buy at such an affordable price.

Got it delivered last week. I got it it for 36999, at this price this the best product. Picture quality is very good, sound is also good. They should have given bluetooth, but not available. Everything is working fine, just a lil bit disappointed with connectivity of Wi-Fi. I was told by the installation guy that this tv supports 4k only via pendrive or external hard disk. I talked to customer service, they also told me the same. Really disappointing that the team of customer support is like this. Actually, I want to tell each nd every user of this tv, that u can add it account and access it in YouTube, after updating it. It can be updated by mirroring the tv to mobile. Just update it, interface will upgrade, u will be able to login YouTube, and in resolution option 4k will open. Customer support team didn't believe me first, on my 2nd call another executive heard and believed me and asked me the process to do so. This long conversation went on because YouTube hot key was not working after updation. And it will not work, that is not a issue, believe me guys, update YouTube, you will appreciate this LED more, as 4k option aur be there. Everything else is fine till now, and hope so would go fine in future. VU, u need to improve ur team, so that they can easily help out these kind of hidden features. Best package, can go for it, no second thought.

I have purchased VU 55" 4K TV on Rs.31979. I can say in this price you can not buy such a 4K smart TV. Picture quality is very good & I have connected to mobile via WiFi, Youtube is working good. Hotstar App is not working. Overall I would suggest to buy the VU TV. I appreciate Flipkart team for the fast delivery of product within 3 days.

Hot star not open,esharing not open.facebook scroll not working only first page showing.esharing wifi need.mobile saved data like photos and documents only u have share.not for chrome cast futures.its not full android TV.only given few apps.first picture hot star maximum 1hr loading not open.above all issues I faced my vu 55inch led TV.

good TV for the price as it bundles all required fetures with the big screen size. have been using it for 10 days till now no issue.

the installation was good but demo was poor. probably the installation guy from Jeeves was less smart compared to the TV.

you may take the extended warranty from Flipkart as it's cheaper compared to market rates. however I have not taken it.

Using this TV from 10 days. It's the cheapest 55 inch 4k TV. For me the picture quality is tooo bright and decreasing the brightness don't really work well. So i prefer muted colors of Soft setting. Its Android 7.0 but there is no playstore. YouTube plays max 1080p resolution. But trust me as i tested many many files that are 4k and both in full hd. Both videos plays exactly same. So 4K upscaling is really good and 4k and 1080p video look almost same unless you are hell bent to find a difference. SD channels look OK and not odd. Full HD DISHTV looks good. But my only concern is tooo bright skin tones and we can't adjust colors when youtube is playing. Sound is just ok. Sometimes 50%sound looks tooo lame in regular size room. For the Price Sony Lg cost over 1 lakh minimum and at this price i got more then what i paid for.

I bought this TV 3 months back. Since then picture quality is a big issue and I am following up with VU support to resolve the same.
Flipkart has washed off their hands by saying that I need to follow up with VU support as they can return only within 10 days.

VU support officially responded that this TV is 4k and full HD picture quality will be bad and recommend me to watch only 4k content.

This is a big let down from brand like VU and Flipkart who is a sole promoter of this brand.
Pathetic...

Bought this Tv @ 37k on Big Billion Sale, Overall Tv was Good, as it's based on Android we can install any APK we want, but main drawback is it doesn't have a play store (its installed but hidden from main menu, but can be launched from another launchers).

Picture Quality is Good It rendered 4k videos also smoothly.

Sound quality is Okay

Connectivity: LAN,Wifi and hotspot is available but it doesn't have Bluetooth

ScreenMirroring, playing remote files is working great with EShare app, also Try BubbleUpNp for better experience.


Overall I would suggest to buy this TV in this budget

1) Getting reddish colour shade over some indoor scenes.
2) No 4k video playback support in youtube app. You can get 4K support by updating the app to latest version through google play but with this the videos on home page and hot key on remote wont work.
3) Hotstar will be crashed when you install from given store. You need to go to play store through browser, update the app then it will work. But it will stuck some times while playing videos in 1080p.
4) No Amazon prime support and Netflix wont play even in 720p resolution.

NOT A PROPER 4K TV

I got this TV during the big billion days sale for 37 grand and at this price point, I must say it is a solid choice even when compared to brands like Samsung and Lg which use the same Led technology and not the Oled ones.
Colour reproduction is good but since this is an led so blacks are not perfect.
I live in a far-off town so delivery took time but I was satisfied with the overall delivery and installation experience.
Coming to the TV itself.
It has a behemoth panel and highly suitable for even a large room size since I myself sit and watch it at 15 feet distance and it feels perfect.
The ports on the rear bottom are accessible even after wall mounting but the ones on the side are inaccessible unless you have really thin hands.
I would advice getting a USB m/f connecting wire which you can connect to the Tv while mounting and use it for connecting/disconnecting the Pen drive.
PROS:
Huge panel at this price and the quality is good too
The sound is ok for normal Tv viewing and is enhanced better when viewing an HD channel since most of them have Dolby Audio
Connectivity ports are plenty. I have an Xbox one s, Dth and a soundbar connected to the 3 HDMI ports.
4k content looks great
There is no Lag what so ever in the smart interface.
CONS:
Not really a smart Tv, limited to Youtube and hotstar.
You must download Vlc player from the TV store as the generic player does not support a lot of video formats including large 4k files.
There is no option to choose the display properties like colour brightness etc in the default smart home or during the Pen drive playback.
Eshare is ok but windows Pc has some issues connecting to eshare.
All that said I would highly recommend this Tv for anyone looking for a budget tv with decent features and a really large screen.
If you want all the smart features, I recommend you go for a chrome cast or a fire stick( it supports 4k now) or a console like I do.
You can also connect it to a soundbar if you want to further enhance the viewing experience but even without it, the speakers would suffice.
P.S. I strongly suggest using a wired LAN connection as it tends to disconnect from the Wi-fi if the signal is not strong.

HAPPY VIUING.

Picture Quality: 4. Crisp and Vivid colors. No Light bleeding detected yet.
Build Quality: 3. Could have been better for such a big and heavy TV.
Software: 1. Utter Laggy Android. Most of the softwares force close. And no idea when any updates are going to come since its still running Android 7.0. I wont suggest installing many apps on this TV as it makes it lag heavily. You cannot use TV settings unless you are out of the home screen onto a different interface.
Interface: 2. It has all the interfaces one may need but after you wall mount the TV you can't reach to the most important ones like USBs and HDMI (ARC). You will need to take the TV off of the wall and then put your USB devices in. Also, the wifi setup keeps switching back to ethernet. WHY?
Sound: The 2 speakers are OK for general viewing. But if there is noise nearby it may get difficult to hear. Like the dialogues will get missed if you are not paying too much attention towards the sound with just a fan running in your room or you'll have to turn up the volume to atleast 40 points.

Vu has cut corners in processor and ram hence the low price. But if you are going to install laggy processor then automatically the price will come down. Vu needs to understand the Indian market since the competition is getting bigger. Won't recommend if these little mistakes aren't fixed.
The CPU utilization is 100% with just one app running. Come-on Vu!

Tips: The stock media player can't run 4K(HEVC) x265 AC3-5.1/7.1 so install Kodi. It is a nice Media centre and can play almost anything on this TV. Though it still cannot play 4K (VP9) 60FPS HDR content properly.

PlayStore: Goto Kodi>Android Apps> Playstore. when you click on it, it will launch Playstore. Though it is very slow on first runs but it works. :)

Do NOT buy this TV if you: (a) Want to cast screen from your phone, (b) Want to watch movies from your hard disk with subtitles, (c) Want to access input ports at the back when mounted on wall

Vu TVs are value for money. But only if you are going to just watch DTH or local cable on it. This particular TV has lot of small issues that frustrates the user. The screen is good, sound is decent. Other than that, following are the many niggles faced:

1. When wall mounted, you cannot access any of the ports at the back. You have to remove the TV from the mount to access.
2. You cannot access settings when using youtube or playing videos from hard disk (settings like adjusting picture or sound). To do that, you need to stop your video, go to the TV home screen, chose AVI as input, there change the settings, go back to main screen, then shift to different input then play your video. VERY frustrating.
3. When you play netflix, the subtitles are perfect. But when you play video from your hard disk with subtitles, you can barely read the text on screen. It is opaque white and is almost useless having subtitles.
4. When playing videos, sometimes there is random jump to different video.
5. There is no gradual fast forward /backward option. You cannot move the video few seconds. It just jumps minutes.
6. One of the biggest disappointments is casting from mobile. You need to download some shady looking app first on your phone, then open it and connect to TV. Then the phone is cast on the screen. But if you play a video on your phone, it plays the audio only on phone and does not cast to the TV. so you end up watching video on TV screen but audio from phone. And there is a big lag between video and audio.

Undoubtedly an excellent 4K TV which is available for affordable price. However, from Android's perspective, most of the apps are not available and hangs every time. Eshare is one more pathetic app where we can only listen audio from mobile and video from TV.

Picture Quality (Rating 4): Crisp and Vivid color. The picture quality is good.
Built Quality (Rating 3): Overall its fine. The wall mounting system is very bad. Its very difficult to on and off from wall.

Software (Rating 1): Find below the cons:
i. Utterly slow Android.
ii. Youtube and Netflix works fine but sometime it crashes too. Live streaming in Hotstar does not work. Other apps does not work, when opened it crashed immediately.
iii. No 4k video playback support in youtube app.
iv. The WiFi setup automatically switch back to Ethernet mode every time you switch on the TV. Why? Its very frustrating.
v. Mirroring works through Eshare. Only the picture gets mirrored to TV not the sound. And the screen mirroring become very slow.

Interface (Rating 2): The interface is not good.
i. The HDMI and USB ports are placed in such a way that after wall mounting those are not accessible. You have to uninstall your TV from wall to use those ports.
ii. None of the videos in the homepage opens. Its getting crashed immediately.
iii. No Bluetooth and poor connectivity.
iv. The home screen content does not update based on the user accessibility.

Sound (Rating 4): The sound quality is good. I have home theater connected to my TV and hence I don't bothered about the sound quality of TV.
Customer Care (Rating 2): The so called technicians are not at all technically sounds. They don't know how to fix the problems. I am pretty worried about the service as I have extended warranty for 2 years.

Overall (Rating 2): I got a big screen in low price with a good picture quality and sound.
